I lurv cute little restaurants in nice areas...you eat a good meal and then shop it off;)  I ordered the grilled cheese and tomato soup.  Was feeling like some comfort food.  I also had a cup coffee, which was only $0.50.  I had ordered the coffee separately, and had only large bills, the guy said forget about it...very nice.  The coffee was a little diluted today, not a big deal.  My food order was good, but not memorable.  My husband ordered the chicken pesto.  It was also good, but not memorable.  I like the vibe at the cafe, and if I lived in the area, I would probably return.  But as a tourist, there are too many other places to try out.

I love the corner, they have probably my favorite breakfast sandwich (bacon, egg and cheese) and the best BLT anywhere.  The spinach salad is also excellent.  hard to go wrong I eat here for lunch a coupe of times a week.

Friendly & attentive staff. Great healthy food options & prices are very reasonable. Parking lot across the street. You order at the counter and they bring the food to you. Great place to have lunch with girlfriends!

This is a nice downtown spot in CityScape.  Lots of urban hipsters abound but if you can get past that it is well worth it.  We were enjoying our time sitting at the counter enjoying the downtown view when the owners came over and said our pancakes had taken too long to get to us - over 12 minutes - so they would be no charge.  We didn't want to say we'd waited longer at IHOP.  We graciously accepted and after paying for only our iced coffees;  we tipped our server mightily.  Very impressed with the customer service.

Went here for the first time a couple weeks ago to meet up w/friends.  The people working here are so friendly and helpful.  I am a tea connoisseur of sorts.  And, they have a great selection of iced teas.  The guy who helped me was so helpful w/all my questions on the teas they have available (which happens to be a great selection).  When I couldn't decide, he recommended what he thought I'd like best and so I went w/his recommendation.  To my surprise, he actually told me there was no charge for the tea because I took his recommendation and 'nobody ever listens to him'. LOL  How funny, and what a kind gesture.  Also, the place is full of take-home items and they have a FABULOUS selection!  So, you can meet your friends here for a casual lunch or snack and then pick up food to take home for dinner so you don't have to cook.  And, the options they have for take-home are really amazing... really delicious healthy foods, but they also have wine in their take-home section too so if you're like me and you like some wine w/your quinoa salad that you take home, they got it... one stop shopping and a great place to meet up w/friends for lunch or a snack.  They've thought of everything.  Great place w/great service and great food AND great iced teas!

I've been into Chloe's a couple times now, so it's due a review.    Today I met a friend who I hadn't seen since last Summer.  Hectic schedules sometimes prevent even the closest of friends from being in the same physical space.  He'd suggested a couple places in CenPho and I wasn't feeling either one of them, so I suggested we just meet up at CItyScape.  I remembered Chloe's was there, so it was a quick decision.  We showed up during the lunchtime rush, which at Chloe's translates to long lines (to the door).  The lines moved fairly quickly, though, so we ordered and got a seat within about 15 minutes.  We ordered the chicken pesto sandwich (me), the hot pastrami and swiss (him) and the classic grilled cheese (DD).    The food arrived with little fanfare and no presentation.  In fact, to take the picture for yelp, I staged my sandwich so you could see its contents.  My adequate sandwich arrived simply sliced in the middle and served with a couple slices of pickle.  The pastrami arrived the same way.  The grilled cheese?  No pickles on the side... just a square sliced diagonally.    My sandwich was slightly better than average, as the warm chicken was quite good.  The pesto was a little bland and the focaccia was just okay... but fresh.  Still, I was a little hungry after finishing (even with pacing myself as much as humanly possible).  My friend felt much the same, perhaps more so.  He couldn't help eyeing DD's plate as she slowly ate her cheese sandwich.  I don't blame him.  If it were just the two of us, I would have stolen a bite of it myself.    I'd give Chloe's a 3.5, but I am rounding up because I love the space, the location and the vibe.   I've had their pastries before and... well... they rock!    I'd go to Chloe's again, but not during the peak lunch hour.  And, I would probably just do the salad bar and a pastry (or six).

I was pleasantly surprised with this place!  Kierland is really uppity in my mind, so I tend to shy away from all their dining options.  Too fancy schmancy for me!  However, after a long day of shopping and browsing the crazy ridiculous Sur La Table, we were getting really hungry.  Chloe's Corner was on our way back to the car so we decided to stop in.  The layout of the place is really cute, and almost retro.  The decor is very tasteful and bright feeling.  We browsed the giant chalkboard menu for a few moments before sitting down and ordering.  I chose the Grilled Ham and Cheese.  It was so DELICIOUS!  It was probably the best grilled sandwich I have ever had, aside from my own.  It was so buttery and toasty on the outside and it had the most amazing crunch.  There was a ton of yummy ham inside with a nice pairing of gooey cheddar cheese.  It was really a great sandwich.  Overall, I really liked this place and would definitely go back if I were in the area.

This place is perfect for a quick sandwich or salad. Usually when I come I get the chipotle raspberry chicken which is awesome. Today I got the veggie which was pretty amazing. My friend got the chicken pesto which was also really good. Unfortunately the sandwiches don't come with any chip or sides, but just a few cut pickles. Otherwise they have a good assortment of bottle beverages and teas. All in all it was a good experience.

This is where I go for coffee EVERY morning before work.   I'm not kidding... EVERY weekday morning.  A cup of coffee is 25 cents!!!  Sometimes I grab a quick lunch here and when I do, it's the American Grilled Cheese ALL THE WAY!  They have a cute little kids' menu and tons of candy jars all over the place.  The decor is really cute and they're always switching it up and changing it.  There are a few tables outside and they have a great beer and wine selection.  They have everything a diner should, from milkshakes to licorice!  The menu is not huge though, but it's healthy (which is a plus in my ratings) and there's definitely something for everyone.  This is a great place for a playful first date, reading the paper by yourself or catching up with a friend.
